intro: Cyrtandra trisse, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Cyrtandra trisse plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
